intro: Adenostyles nebrodensis, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. Adenostyles nebrodensis is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
